title: The world's first civil union
description: In 1989, Denmark became the first country to celebrate same-sex civil unions. In 2014, Farhana Haider spoke to Ivan Larsen and Ove Carlsen, who were one of the first couples to sign on the dotted line
itunes:subtitle: In 1989, Denmark became the first country to celebrate same-sex civil unions
itunes:summary: In 1989, Denmark became the first country to celebrate same-sex civil unions. In 2014, Farhana Haider spoke to Ivan Larsen and Ove Carlsen, who were one of the first couples to sign on the dotted line
itunes:author: BBC World Service
